info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 6 at 3:41PM EDT until August 6 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Broward.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the weston area during the last hour with the thunderstorms. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area during the next hour with the thunderstorms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall rates increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning maybe needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pembroke Pines, Davie, Sunrise, Weston, Intersection I-75 And Griffin Road and Markham Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
